intro: Erythranthe sierrae, commonly known as Sierra fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountains of California. It is a member of the flowering plant family Montiaceae and is characterized by its striking red to orange-pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Erythranthe sierrae is adapted to cold, dry conditions and is often found in open meadows or along stream banks.
